channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: These investigators patrol Las Vegas looking for one thing: water waste
item.description: The Southern Nevada Water Authority has investigators who patrol Las Vegas neighborhoods in search of wasted water.

item.title: What will the end of the 'de minimis' rule mean for U.S. consumers?
item.description: On Friday, the U.S. is ending its de minimis rule that made it easy for cheap goods to reach consumers. The change will affect roughly 4 million such ...

item.title: Speaker Johnson slashed Medicaid. His constituents could lose health services
item.description: In Mike Johnson's district, not only could thousands of Louisianians lose coverage, health centers are bracing for a financial hit. They're hoping for...

item.title: The road to famine: How U.S. policy failed Palestinians in Gaza
item.description: As famine plagues Gaza, NPR exclusive reporting looks at the U.S.'s role in the humanitarian crisis. Many former officials NPR interviewed share a com...

item.title: Amtrak's flagship Acela trains get a long-awaited upgrade
item.description: The NextGen Acela trains, as Amtrak calls them, are faster and lighter than the current fleet. They're scheduled to start revenue service along the No...

item.title: Hundreds honor 2 children killed and 17 people wounded in shooting at a Minneapolis Catholic school
Minneapolis Catholic schoolchildren listened to a prayer, then ducked for cover from gunfire
item.description: The pews of a Minneapolis church were packed with teachers, parents and schoolchildren paired with older ‘buddies’ listening to a prayer on their thir...

item.title: New study sheds light on what kinds of workers are losing jobs to AI
item.description: Stanford University research offers insights for students and young workers as artificial intelligence begins to reshape the labor market.

item.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un to join Putin at China military parade
item.description: The reclusive North Korean leader's attendance at the event comes days after Trump said he wants to meet Kim.

item.title: Xi shows Trump who holds the cards as he sets up meeting with Kim and Putin
item.description: The leaders of North Korea and Russia will attend China's military parade next week - a win for Xi.

item.title: Teenager who shot Colombian senator sentenced to seven years
item.description: The 39-year-old politician was shot in the head during a presidential rally in Bogotá in June.

item.title: 8/27: CBS Evening News
item.description: Everything we know about the Minneapolis school shooting; Sen. Klobuchar says former staffer's kids witnessed Minneapolis school shooting

item.title: FBI investigates Minneapolis school shooting as anti-Catholic hate crime
item.description: Two children were killed when an attacker opened fire through the windows of the city's Annunciation Church.

item.title: 8/27: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Two children were killed and 17 people are injured in a Minneapolis school shooting; President Trump orders flags to be flown at half-staff after the ...

item.title: Kristen Trickle: Autopsy of the Mind
item.description: A Kansas woman is found dying from a gunshot wound. Evidence at the scene doesn’t add up, so a prosecutor gets creative. "48 Hours" correspondent Erin...

item.title: Huge Russian attack on Kyiv kills 14, including 3 kids, Zelenskyy says

item.title: Caning and fines for those caught in Singapore drug vape crackdown
item.description: A rise in popularity of vapes laced with etomidate, an anaesthetic drug, has caused widespread alarm.

item.title: Guard not needed in Chicago, Pritzker tells AP during tour of city to counter Trump’s crime claims
